sunk_costs.note: Already spent. Cannot recover. But ongoing Frontline costs (~$2.7M/yr) are still actionable.
Can't recover past surpluses, but establishes that current 'we're broke' projections are unreliable.

actionable.source: Reduce healthcare staffing agencies by 50% (hire permanent)
actionable.what_it_takes: Hiring + onboarding permanent speech pathologists, nurses, therapists
actionable.detail: Total healthcare staffing contractor spend: $21,681,106. Previously identified: Speech Pathology Group ($5.8M), Ro Health ($4.3M), Aequor ($2.0M), Amergis ($1.5M), Maxim ($926K), BMR ($900K). Newly classified: RCM Technologies ($2.5M), Pioneer Healthcare ($1.6M), Stepping Stones Group ($1.5M), Sunbelt Staffing ($740K). At $150K fully-loaded cost per FTE, this buys ~144 permanent staff.

actionable.what_it_takes: Internal IT capacity building, completing Frontline transition
actionable.detail: Total cuttable IT consulting: $20,046,874. Previously identified: Galaxy Solutions ($7.1M), Infosys ($5.7M), Filippini ($876K), Arey-Jones ($758K), Edupoint ($755K). Newly classified: Protiviti ($5.6M), SAP Public Services ($1.1M), Syntex Global ($610K). BLA already flagged excessive IT consulting spending.

actionable.source: Shift after-school programs to restricted funds where eligible
actionable.what_it_takes: Grant writing + fund coding review. Many programs eligible for ASES, 21st CCLC, Title I funds.
actionable.detail: Total after-school contractor spend: $46,179,571. Previously identified: YMCA ($14.4M), Bay Area Community Resources ($10.5M), Mission Graduates ($5.9M), Jamestown ($1.9M), Real Options ($1.6M). Newly classified: Richmond Neighborhood Center ($2.9M), Community Youth Center ($2.1M), Boys & Girls Clubs ($1.1M), Richmond Area Multi-Services ($1.1M), Telegraph Hill ($720K), LearnUp ($760K), Arise ($700K). Conservative: 25% could shift to restricted funds.

actionable.what_it_takes: Competitive bidding, route optimization, potential in-house fleet
actionable.detail: Zum Services: $38,374,008. Competitive rebid could yield 15-25% savings.

actionable.source: Use fund balance surplus (documented recurring pattern)
actionable.what_it_takes: Political will. District consistently ends with $80-170M more than projected.
actionable.detail: FY2022-23: projected $307M, actual $413M (+$106M). FY2023-24: projected $383M, actual $468M (+$85M). Conservative: use $20M of the recurring surplus for ongoing raises.

structural.source: Cut admin FTEs to peer median (phased, ~200 positions)
structural.what_it_takes: Attrition + reorganization. BLA found 220 central FTEs/10K students vs 138 median.
structural.detail: Admin spending gap: $112,194,092 (15.1% vs 10.9% peer median). Closing half = $56,097,046. At $150K/FTE, that's ~373 positions.
